work.name: Mim solutions
highlights: Contributed to a project aimed at matching tweets with corresponding articles, which culminated in a paper submission. My responsibilities included implementing a LDA baseline model and developing a PyTorch implementation for the primary model. The architecture of our model was similar to Open AI's CLIP architecture
Contributed to work flow of other teams by helping with incorporation of tools such as: Hydra, pytorch ligtning, docker and ruff
Helped with conceptual work when working on theoretical foundations of projects

courses: Probability theory I, Probability theory II, Functional analysis, Statistics, Deep learning, Natural league processing, Reinforcement learning
Concurrent programming, Algorithms and Data structures, Databases, Object oriented programming, C++/Rust course, Operating systems

projects.name: Continous integration tool
projects.summary: This is my attempt on writing continous integration tool, written solely in Rust. It works (sadly) only in local environments and need some preparation from the user - most notably sourcing evironmental variables, more info can be found here: https://github.com/jkozlovvski/CI-rust
